intro: Lancisia coronopifolia, commonly known as the royal lanzonia, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
